title: Mastering the PostgreSQL Engine: A Deep Dive into Strategic Business Intelligence üöÄ
description: By following a professional end-to-end workflow, I applied the three core pillars of Business Intelligence: Descriptive Analytics, Diagnostic Analytics, Precriptive Analytics to 3,900 rows of retail data
content:
Mastering the PostgreSQL Engine: A Deep Dive into Strategic Business Intelligence üöÄ

I‚Äôve just completed a company-standard Business Analytics project‚Äîmoving beyond basic spreadsheets to build a robust analytical framework where PostgreSQL served as the central engine for serious data interrogation.

PostgreSQLPython (Pandas)Power BI3,900 Rows

Professional workflow outcome: I followed an end-to-end BI process and applied the three core pillars of Business Intelligence to 3,900 rows of retail transactional data‚Äîtransforming raw records into clear insights and actionable strategy.

The 3 BI pillars applied to my retail dataset

üìä Descriptive Analytics (What happened?)Baseline

Using Python (Pandas) for EDA and Power BI for KPI tracking, I established a clean baseline across 3,900 transactions. I tracked total revenue, average spend, and customer counts to make the dataset immediately report-ready.

Total RevenueAvg SpendCustomer CountKPI Tracking
üîç Diagnostic Analytics (Why did it happen?)Root Cause

This is where PostgreSQL took center stage. I used advanced SQL‚ÄîCTEs, Window Functions, and CASE statements‚Äîto explain the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù behind revenue patterns and customer behavior.

Questions I answered with SQL: Why do some products rely heavily on discounts to sell? Why are repeat buyers not yet subscribers? What specific segments and items are driving revenue?

  • SQLRanked products using ROW_NUMBER() to identify top performers and discount-dependence patterns.
  • SEGSegmented customers into New, Returning, and Loyal cohorts to uncover the drivers behind repeat purchases.
  • WHYUsed CTEs + CASE logic to isolate root causes and make insights report-ready for dashboards.
üí° Prescriptive Analytics (What should we do?)Action

Data is useless without action. I translated insights into strategic business recommendations designed to directly improve revenue, retention, and customer experience.

  • Targeted marketing: focus campaigns on high-revenue Young Adult demographics.
  • Loyalty incentives: transition Returning customers into the Loyal bracket.
  • Shipping optimization: improve express shipping options based on higher average customer spend.

üß† Key Learning Moments

Intelligent ImputationData Integrity

I avoided a common beginner mistake: instead of imputing missing ratings with one global average, I used category-specific medians (e.g., clothing vs. footwear). This kept the data realistic and protected analytical accuracy.

SQL TechnicalitiesClean Reporting

I mastered type-casting in PostgreSQL‚Äîcasting calculations to numeric to avoid double precision rounding issues and produce clean, dashboard-ready outputs.

Final note

By integrating Python engineering, PostgreSQL analysis, and Power BI visualization, I‚Äôve gained the technical confidence to handle the complete Business Analytics lifecycle‚Äîexactly how it‚Äôs done in real companies.

title: Interactive Road Accident Analysis Dashboard
description: Designed and implemented an interactive Excel dashboard to drive data-led road safety decisions.
content:
Turning 307,000+ Rows of Raw Data into Life-Saving Insights üöóüìä

I‚Äôm thrilled to share my latest project: a comprehensive Road Accident Analysis Dashboard built entirely in Excel. This isn‚Äôt just a spreadsheet‚Äîit‚Äôs a dynamic command centre designed for stakeholders like the Ministry of Transport and Police to drive data-led safety decisions.

The Challenge:

The main challenge was processing a massive dataset of 307,000 records across 2024 and 2025 to identify critical road safety trends. Raw data is noisy‚Äîso I performed rigorous data cleaning (correcting typos and handling missing values) and data processing to extract monthly and yearly trends.

Key Project Highlights

  1. Primary KPIs: High-impact visibility of total casualties, accident severity (Fatal, Serious, Slight), and the vehicle types most involved.
  2. Year-on-Year (YoY) Analysis: Monthly trend charts comparing current vs. previous year performance to spot seasonal spikes.
  3. Granular Insights: Deep dives into casualties by road surface, light conditions, and area type (Urban vs. Rural).
  4. Fully Interactive UI: Integrated Slicers, allowing users to filter 300k+ rows of data in a single click for instant reporting.
  5. The Tech Stack: Advanced Excel, Pivot Tables, Complex Formulas (GETPIVOTDATA) and Custom Data Visualization.

Data is only as good as the decisions it enables. This dashboard transforms ‚Äúbig data‚Äù into a clear, actionable story
